metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3998 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The (1) banshee-1 and (2) muinshee scripts in Banshee 1.8.0 and earlierplace a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allowslocal users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in thecurrent working directory.  NOTE: Banshee might also be affected usingGST_PLUGIN_PATH.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

banshee - 2.4.0-2ubuntu1
banshee-extension-soundmenu - 2.4.0-2ubuntu1
banshee-meego - 2.4.0-2ubuntu1
monodoc-banshee-manual - 2.4.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: banshee package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-2ubuntu1').
